title: Engine misfire under load but smooth at idle
symptoms: Car shakes or hesitates when accelerating
Check engine light with misfire codes (P0300–P030x)
Idle feels mostly smooth
possible_causes: Weak ignition coil on one cylinder
Worn spark plugs or plug wires
recommended_actions: Scan for diagnostic trouble codes to see which cylinder is affected
Inspect and replace spark plugs if worn or overdue
Swap ignition coils between cylinders to see if misfire follows the coil (for mechanics)
If misfire persists, fuel pressure and injectors should be checked by technician

title: Steering wheel shakes at highway speeds only
symptoms: Vibration between 60–75 mph (100–120 km/h)
Steering wheel oscillates left-right
No vibration at low speed
possible_causes: Uneven tire wear or separated belt
Worn tie rod ends or suspension bushings
recommended_actions: Have front wheels balanced on a proper machine
Inspect wheels for visible bends or cracks
Check tires for bulges, flat spots, or irregular wear
If vibration remains after balancing, suspension components should be inspected

title: Grinding noise when braking
symptoms: Loud metal-on-metal sound when pressing brake pedal
Stopping distance increased
Brake warning light may be on
possible_causes: Foreign object trapped between pad and rotor
recommended_actions: Do not continue driving long distances with grinding brakes; it is unsafe
Schedule immediate brake inspection and pad/rotor replacement
If pedal feels soft or sinks, have vehicle towed instead of driving

title: Engine temperature fluctuates up and down
symptoms: Gauge moves from normal to hot then back
Heater may blow hot then cold
No visible coolant leak
possible_causes: Failing water pump or slipping belt
recommended_actions: Check coolant level only when engine is completely cold
If low, inspect for external leaks around hoses and radiator
Have mechanic bleed cooling system and test thermostat operation
Do not drive the car if temperature goes into red zone

title: Clicking noise from CV axle when turning
symptoms: Rhythmic clicking or popping while making tight turns
Noise louder when accelerating during the turn
Usually from front of vehicle (FWD cars)
possible_causes: Damaged or torn CV boot losing grease
recommended_actions: Inspect CV boots for tears and grease splatter
If clicking is consistent, CV axle likely needs replacement
Avoid full-lock hard turns until repaired to reduce risk of failure

title: ABS warning light on with normal braking feel
symptoms: ABS light illuminated on dash
Brakes work but ABS does not activate on hard stops
Sometimes traction control light also on
possible_causes: Damaged tone ring or rust on hub
recommended_actions: Have codes read with ABS-capable scan tool to identify which wheel or circuit
Visually inspect wiring and connectors at each wheel for damage
Driving is usually safe with moderate braking, but ABS function is reduced
Repair should be done as soon as practical for maximum safety

title: Fuel smell around car but no visible leak
symptoms: Strong gasoline odor near rear of car or fuel filler area
Check engine light with EVAP system codes
Smell stronger after refueling
possible_causes: Cracked EVAP hoses or charcoal canister
Small leak at fuel tank top or sender unit
recommended_actions: Ensure fuel cap is tightly closed until it clicks several times
Inspect around filler neck for cracks or rust
If smell is very strong or visible wet fuel is seen, do not drive and seek towing
Mechanic can smoke-test EVAP system for small leaks

title: Transmission slipping on acceleration (automatic)
symptoms: Engine revs increase but vehicle speed rises slowly
Shifts feel delayed or harsh
Burnt smell from transmission area
possible_causes: Faulty shift solenoids or valve body
Overheating from towing or heavy load
recommended_actions: Check transmission fluid level and color according to owner’s manual
If fluid is dark/burnt, have professional service performed (no aggressive power flushing on very old units)
Avoid towing or hard acceleration until issue is diagnosed
Prolonged slipping can quickly destroy transmission; repair promptly

title: Battery repeatedly dies overnight
symptoms: Car starts after jump but battery is dead next morning
Lights or accessories may be left on
Sometimes no obvious cause
possible_causes: Old or weak battery near end of life
Charging system not fully recharging battery
recommended_actions: Have battery load-tested and charging system checked
Ensure interior lights, trunk light, and glovebox light are turning off
If battery is good, mechanic can perform parasitic draw test with ammeter
Until fixed, disconnect battery negative terminal if safe and you are comfortable doing so

title: Sudden loss of power with turbocharged engine
symptoms: Car feels very weak, like turbo not working
Check engine light with boost or airflow codes
Whooshing sound or hiss under acceleration
possible_causes: Boost leak from intercooler hose or clamp
Faulty boost control solenoid or wastegate
Limp mode activated to protect engine
recommended_actions: Inspect visible intercooler hoses for loose clamps or splits
Avoid heavy acceleration until cause is found
Have codes read and freeze-frame data checked by qualified technician
Driving gently may be possible in limp mode, but long trips should be avoided
